page.title: 19DOMESTICATED ANIMALS(FARLEY)
page.content: On the farms around Farley we keep cows, sheep, chickens and pigs for slaughter. The meat is then eaten. We also keep the cows for milk, the chickens for their eggs and the sheep for their wool. We also keep animals as pets. Some of these are kept for company such as dogs and cats. Most animals are kept for interest such as guinea pigs, hamsters, rabbits, fish, tortoises, goats and quite a few more. People also keep horses and ponies for riding. Not only do people keep dogs as company but they also enjoy taking the dogs for walks. Most of the population have at least one pet. At school, we keep two rabbits as pets. Their names are Cinders and Candy.
